article.description: Lawrence Roberts had 17 points and 10 rebounds and Mississippi State (No. 15 ESPN/USA Today; No. 11 AP) rebounded from a rare road loss with an 80-55 victory over Arkansas on Saturday.
article.headline: Bulldogs rebound from road loss with home win
article.linkText: Home cookin': Mississippi St. tops Arkansas
article.story: STARKVILLE, Miss. (AP) -- Mississippi State's long road winning streak is history. A fast start against Arkansas made certain the Bulldogs' streak at home was never in jeopardy. Lawrence Roberts had 17 points and 10 rebounds and the Bulldogs (No. 15 ESPN/USA Today; No. 11 AP) rebounded from a rare road loss with an 80-55 victory over Arkansas on Saturday. It was Mississippi State's first game since its first road loss in nearly 2 years, and coach Rick Stansbury was unsure how his team would respond to the 64-63 loss at Tennessee in which the Bulldogs seemed lost without injured guard Winsome Frazier. "I'm very proud of our basketball team, not just with the win, but how we won under all the circumstances," Stansbury said. "We proved something today that was a big question mark -- can we win, and can we play without Winsome Frazier?" They can, and they did. Marcus Campbell had 15 points and Ontario Harper added 12 for the Bulldogs (15-3, 3-1 Southeastern Conference), who never trailed, held the Razorbacks almost 24 points below their average to win their third straight in the series and ninth straight at home. "We came out with energy. At Tennessee, we closed out the second half with a lot of energy (and) we just wanted to do a good job from the jump," Roberts said. Mississippi State bounced back from that defeat by shooting 48 percent from the field and not allowing Arkansas to get closer than 13 points in the second half. Jonathon Modica had 14 points to lead Arkansas (13-4, 1-3), which lost its third straight. Leading scorer Ronnie Brewer was held to seven points on 3-of-10 shooting, and finished nearly 10 points below his average. "What happened to our basketball team was, we had no inside game," Arkansas coach Stan Heath said. "We got off to a poor start, understatement." Mississippi State opened with a 21-2 run over the first 8 minutes behind nine points from Campbell. "I didn't think we'd come out and throw a punch like we threw," Stansbury said. Arkansas missed 12 of its first 13 shots and went scoreless over a span of 5:38 in falling behind by 19 points. "I thought they were open, (shooting) shots that guys have been making for most of the year," Heath said. The Razorbacks countered with a 12-3 spurt to cut it to 10, but couldn't get any closer in the first half and had more turnovers (9) than field goals (8) in the first 20 minutes. "Coach is always preaching defense -- if you play defense, the offense will come," Campbell said. The Bulldogs were playing their second straight game without Frazier, their top 3-point shooter and perimeter defender and second-leading scorer. Once again, they missed his production. Mississippi State's starting backcourt of Gary Ervin and Jamall Edmondson finished a combined 4-of-14 from the field and 0-of-7 from 3-point range. Frazier, who is probably out for the rest of the season with a broken foot, received standing ovations during warmups and pregame introductions in his first appearance at Humphrey Coliseum since the injury. Several players wrote Frazier's number "23" on their sneakers. "Frazier is a humongous part of our team," Campbell said.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
